qas.question: What epic poem did Luís de Camões write?
What was Luís de Camões main influence?
What styles are modern Portuguese poetry rooted in?
Who are some modern Portuguese authors?

answers.text: Almeida Garrett, Camilo Castelo Branco, Eça de Queiroz, Fernando Pessoa, Sophia de Mello Breyner Andresen, António Lobo Antunes and Miguel Torga

context: <a0_0>Adventurer and poet<a0_0/> Luís de Camões (c. 1524–1580) wrote the epic poem <a1_0>"Os Lusíadas" (The Lusiads)<a1_0/>, with <a2_0>Virgil's Aeneid<a2_0/> as his main influence. Modern Portuguese poetry is rooted in <a3_0>neoclassic and contemporary styles<a3_0/>, as exemplified by Fernando Pessoa (1888–1935). Modern Portuguese literature is represented by authors such as <a4_0>Almeida Garrett, Camilo Castelo Branco, Eça de Queiroz, Fernando Pessoa, Sophia de Mello Breyner Andresen, António Lobo Antunes and Miguel Torga<a4_0/>. Particularly popular and distinguished is José Saramago, recipient of the 1998 Nobel Prize in Literature.
